Class Date

  • java.lang.Object
    • Date

  • public class Date
extends java.lang.Object
    Encapsulation of Java's Calendar class for ease of use
    Author:
    Rimantas Kazlauskas

      • compare

        public int compare(Date anotherDate)
        Compares 2 dates.

        Example: date1.compare(date2).

        Parameters:
        anotherDate - date to be compared with
        Returns:
        day difference between 2 dates

      • getDaysInYear

        private int getDaysInYear()
        Gets date as days instead of the usual dd/mm/yyyy format (e.g. december 31st is 365)
        Returns:
        date in days

      • getMaxDaysInYear

        private int getMaxDaysInYear()
        Gets the maximum days in a year.
        Returns:
        max days in a year

      • forwardDate

        public void forwardDate(int days)
        Forwards the date by a specified amount of days
        Parameters:
        days - to be forwarded

      • setDate

        private void setDate(int year,
                     int month,
                     int day)
        sets date to a specified date.
        Parameters:
        year - minimum 1
        month - 0-11
        day - 1-30

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        returns date in DDMMYYYY format, used for database
        Overrides:

        See Also:

      • isBefore

        public boolean isBefore(Date date)
        Checks whatever the date is before another date
        Parameters:
        date - to be compared
        Returns:
        True of this is before the param date

      • toCalendar

        private java.util.Calendar toCalendar()
        effectively casting back to Calendar

        this as calendar
